result.execSummary:
The defendant Heidi Rene Sherman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash Bond previously posted in the amount of $200.00 has been applied.  The remaining balance of the Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

Case Called @ 1:56 PM: Defendant Heidi Rene Sherman in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Per DA:  2 options on offers extended.  Defendant will plead to Ct 1 as issued and DA will argue for costs only.  Def confirms resolution.    Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea Ct 1 (POT):  GP  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Ct 2 DRI.  Statement by Def:  None offered.   The Court:  Imposes Court Costs only - $200 bond to be applied - 60 DTP or PP.   DNA Sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.  Sample to be provided by the end of the day today.  Appeal Rights Given.  Expungement process of DNA sample explained to Def through DOJ.

Pre-trial conference at 07-09-2015 11:30 am.
Status conference at 08-04-2015 09:55 am.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case Called Early @ 1:25 PM: Defendant Heidi Rene Sherman in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def states she would like counsel, not employed.  Def referred to SPD for eligibility.  NGP entered by Court.   Defendant changes her mind and wishes to speak with the State on her own.  Court accepts waiver of counsel today.  PTC/STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 09:55 am.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 11:30 am.
